title: Daily reminder that Runeglaive only benefits Ezreal
body:
I just want Magus back. I don't care if Magus wasn't great in the first place, I want my god damn 20% CDR and actual decent amount of AP.

It's so dumb that literally only Ezreal is getting benefits from it and now IT'S GETTING NERFED ON PBE BECAUSE OF FUCKING EZREAL.

Punish junglers because Ezreal's a piece of shit abusing items that are bad on junglers. Seems fair.

What are you on about? Her clears are fucking godly. You can finish your full clear at 3.45, less if you got a decent leash.
It's just her lack of pressure, awkward build paths and awkward ganks that makes her weak at jungling.
Her mana issues aren't that bad, I've played her a couple times and I only need second blue when I burned a lot of mana on ganks.
depends shield helps her a lot. main thing is that her clear is super slow.

Diana clears extremely fast and easily. She destroys camps so fast it's silly. Even early, she barely even needs a leash. She doesn't have mana issues either if you can manage her mana correctly. The only mana issues she has is in extended fights/sieges. Diana gets to this point where she can literally 2 shot the enemy ADC though if she can get onto them, which is rather easy. She's really good at diving the backline but at the same time she is prone to being focused down quickly.
Probably haven't been clearing properly then. Not the first time that has happened to me.
As jungle Diana, max shield first. It goes through camps like crazy, not to mention during ganks it is actually your primary damage source.

"The last AP jungle item wasn't that great, so instead of asking people who play AP junglers what they would like to see as an item, we are going to make up some shit and hope it works". I mean, how hard would it be to get a few of the older jungle players like Saint and OddOne in a skype call and be like, "So guys, you've played everything in the jungle, from A to Z. I can tell you right now that it's going to involve mana regen, ap, possibly cooldown reduction, and a way of not getting you ass stomped by everything at levels 1-3. Simple formula, simple item, works.

They need to just find a way to stop with Ezreal abusing all these items. He has been at the heart of so many jungle item abuse cases (except Cinderhulk) that its ridiculous. It isn't even just jungle items Either.

The heart of jungle item abuse? Lol..? What other item has he used? Elder Lizard? He wasn't even the only one abusing it then. Evelynn was an ungodly abuser of that item while build Ability Power! And even then, it didn't get nerfed, it just got changed to Physical Damage causes it... This is literally the first jungle item Ezreal has been able to 'abuse'.

Only other item he got nerfed/changed was Phage, but that nerf was only to other ranged champions who were also using it, making them a bit overly powerful as well, so.... yeeaah.

I'm pretty sure Akali got Gunblade nerfed a lot harder back in the day than Ezreal has ever gotten any item nerfed now. Runeglaive is being nerfed in the next patch because Scarizard is a fricken moron. He's the one who seems to want this change to go through as he's mentioned on his Twitter when he brought up the Ezreal Nerfs not lasting on the PBE. 

Honestly? They're gutting this item because of Diana as well. Laning Dianas have been taking smite in solo-que and destroying with it as well, but you won't hear any QQ about that because she wasn't the one brought into LCS. Laning Fizz is also pretty damn broken with this item since it gives him a lot more base damage in his combo for cheaper early on when his damage isn't so great. It's higher base damage was just better overall for laners since it completely removed the early game issue with a cheap item that gave a huge boost, just like a Trinity Force does for an AD Ez or Corki, except cheaper and used on Assassins.

When it comes down to it, Sheen just isn't meant to be in the jungle. It needs to be strong for junglers to be able to use it for clearing, but if it's strong enough for them, it's strong enough for a laner as well. Throw new item item into the game that increases magic damage to monsters and returns mana based on the damage dealt to monsters, make it combine with the jungle smite and turn into the old magus with boosted magic damage verse jungle monsters and mana return based on damage dealt to monsters.
Ezreal caused nerfs to iceborn gauntlet, muramana, elder lizard, and runeglaive.

No he didn't. 0.o Muramana was never nerfed. It was nerfed for Ryze when it was changed to Physical damage, but that was a BUFF for Ezreal. It has received no changes since. Elder Lizard was abused also by Evelynn and Kayle who used huge amounts of magic DPS to keep the passive running. Runeglaive was nerfed because of Ez, Diana, and Fizz all becoming strong with this item as well as Evelynn in the jungle being too strong with it. There were many abuse cases that people never realized because they're too busy watching LCS and going 'OOOO, AP EZ IS ABUSING THIS ITEM AND EVERYONE IN SOLOQ IS COPYING IT'. Plenty of others abuse it to.

Only one Ez actually got nerfed was Iceborn, but it all honesty, it was a bit too powerful anyways. 15% CDR, large amount of armor, spell blade effect, high amount of mana... I mean, it was so much better than Frozen Heart on release and it's been changed around so it wouldn't be so powerful.

I just want to play {{champion:9}} again, how is it increasing diversity if your just gonna make the only mage jungle item completely worthless on him? All junglers should have equal rights to a jungle item that fits them. Why couldn't we have both runeglaive and magus what is bad about having more jungle items it means more diversity to the game. A term Riot has mentioned many times that's in their agenda to help. But apparently isn't seen as one from the community.

To be honest, I'm not sure that we would see more diversity with both Runeglaive and Magus in the game because the AP jungle champion pool would be decided by which one is better. 

Is Magus better? Then those that use Runeglaive aren't worth playing because Magus is better, even though a bunch of other champs might be good because Runeglaive fixes their mana problems.

Is Runeglaive better? Then those that run Magus won't be played with Magus, and would either run Runeglaive or just not run a jungle item at all, and we get to a situation like we have now with Magus, except that instead of being removed from the game, it's still in the game but might as well not be there anyways.

Even if Runeglaive and Magus were equally good, players would still play Magus because they know who is good with Magus but not who is good with Runeglaive, especially since AP junglers have never been viable on a grand scale the way AD junglers and tank junglers are. Players won't create the diversity that Runeglaive tried to promote because players won't try out the new item with junglers that could be viable but weren't with Magus.

Also, have you tried full tank jungle {{champion:9}} ? It's really fun, and is a good way to enjoy Fiddlesticks while the AP jungle item is bad for him.

What? That makes absolutely no sense whatsoever. Why would Ezreal warrant that hard of a nerf? It doesn't even remotely make him overpowered. Buying it on Ezreal means sacrificing your entire early game so that you can crowed clear like a normal mid laner. Something like a mejai or ludens rush would give you a much faster power spike except you will fall behind in cs so badly people will claim your shit even though you are 20/4/15

>Buying it on Ezreal means sacrificing your entire early game so that you can crowed clear like a normal mid lane

Not really. You don't end up sacrificing that much early power. It helps address mana problems, you still get an early sheen for laning, and it gives you the ability to actually push other people in instead of just losing everything to tower. It then scales better than pretty much any item he could have just because of the magic damage conversion. It's not a sacrifice if it's the best option for him, and it really is.

It's legitimately overpowered. It's quickly become pick/ban in all the competitive scenes. A nerf to either him or the item is needed, and they chose the item. I'm not thrilled with the exact direction they took, but something does have to be done.

All you get in regards to mana is the flat mana the item itself provides... I'd like it if people stopped hinting the 8% missing mana works in lane because it doesn't. It's monster only and even then you'd need a bigger mana pool for it to be noticable if you Q raptors at low mana. It gives you something like a net worth of 30 mana back when Q'ing raptors at 1/8 mana left...

The only reason why this item has some strength in it is the magic damage conversion and a slight increase in waveclear.
Lose the conversion to magic damage it's useless. Don't lose it, ap ez is still not even close to OP.

It's a pretty bad item anyway I'd prefer magus back.

I don't want Magus back. It staled the AP jungler champion pool to AP champions that only those who actually had mana to jungle could jungle, and only a few had the mana to jungle (or otherwise were resourceless, but still didn't jungle).

I don't want Runeglaive like it is now. It broadened the AP jungle champion pool to those that mana wasn't a restriction, but then narrowed it to those that could use a Sheen proc well, which were champions that were already good in the jungle, or could do without a jungle item.

We need a new AP jungle item that had stats closer to Magus (maybe not the same stats, but still similar) but have mana regeneration like Runeglaive gives, as we will never otherwise have a good AP jungle item for both item strength and AP jungle diversity.

Anyone who AA once every 3s basically will have their mana cost removed. I failed to see how it's bad.

That was the good part about it. Having the mana cost removed is the reason why Runeglaive is so good, and why I love Runeglaive on live. It enabled so many champions to be playable in the jungle just by fixing mana costs as a problem.

It's just everything else that is bad about it. The poor stats and a passive that most champs didn't want were so much worse than the mana regeneration portion of the passive that people wrote it off. It fixed mana problems but created other problems in the jungle.
